impl.owls.process.execution
Class StandardExecutionValidator

java.lang.Object
  impl.owls.process.execution.StandardExecutionValidator
All Implemented Interfaces:
ExecutionValidator
public class StandardExecutionValidator
extends java.lang.Object
implements ExecutionValidator

Standard implementation that realizes evaluation of preconditions and effects (which are specified in OWL-S inside results).

Constructor Summary
StandardExecutionValidator()
          Pre-conditions will be checked, results will not be checked, and multiple satisfied pre-conditions are allowed.

StandardExecutionValidator

public StandardExecutionValidator()
Pre-conditions will be checked, results will not be checked, and multiple satisfied pre-conditions are allowed.

Method Detail

checkPreconditions

public void checkPreconditions(Process process,
                               ValueMap<ProcessVar,OWLValue> values,
                               OWLKnowledgeBase kb)
                        throws PreconditionException
Specified by:
checkPreconditions in interface ExecutionValidator
Parameters:
process - The process whose execution will be done next.
values - The set of process variable bindings that exist at the time of precondition evaluation. Since precondition evaluation happens prior to execution the map would contain only inputs bound to their value. Note that evaluation of preconditions may bind existential process variables (if any). If so, implementations of this method must put them in this map.
kb - All the (domain) knowledge available right now.
Throws:
UnsatisfiedPreconditionException - In case ExecutionValidator.isPreconditionCheck() returns true and some precondition of the given process is not satisfied.
MultipleSatisfiedPreconditionException - In case ExecutionValidator.isPreconditionCheck() returns true, ExecutionValidator.isAllowMultipleSatisifedPreconditions() returns false and some precondition of the given process has multiple different "solutions", i.e., it can be satisfied by different bindings of variables in the precondition.
PreconditionException

checkResults

public void checkResults(Process process,
                         ValueMap<ProcessVar,OWLValue> values,
                         OWLKnowledgeBase kb)
                  throws ExecutionException
Specified by:
checkResults in interface ExecutionValidator
Parameters:
process - The current process whose execution was done and whose result(s) are to be evaluated.
values - The set of process variables that exist in the scope of the given process. In case of result evaluation this can be inputs that were consumed by the process, outputs produced by the process, locals used within the process, and existentials bound by preconditions.
kb - All the (domain) knowledge available right now.
Throws:
ResultException - In case application of the effects of some result caused the kb to become inconsistent.
ExecutionException

public boolean isAllowMultipleSatisifedPreconditions()
Specified by:
isAllowMultipleSatisifedPreconditions in interface ExecutionValidator
Returns:
true if multiple satisfied preconditions are allowed.

isPreconditionCheck

Specified by:
isPreconditionCheck in interface ExecutionValidator
Returns:
true if validation of preconditions will be done.

isResultCheck

public boolean isResultCheck()
Specified by:
isResultCheck in interface ExecutionValidator
Returns:
true if validation of results (effects) will be done.

setAllowMultipleSatisfiedPreconditions

public void setAllowMultipleSatisfiedPreconditions(boolean allowMultipleSatisifedPreconditions)
Description copied from interface: ExecutionValidator
Set the behavior that determines if evaluation of a precondition that can be satisfied by multiple different bindings of variables occurring in the precondition is regarded a evaluation failure or not. If this option is enabled then in such a situation the execution engine will arbitrarily pick a value from any of the different bindings that exist and continue.

Specified by:
setAllowMultipleSatisfiedPreconditions in interface ExecutionValidator
Parameters:
allowMultipleSatisifedPreconditions - If true multiple value bindings for variables used in preconditions is allowed. If false then such a situation would cause throwing a MultipleSatisfiedPreconditionException.

setPreconditionCheck

public void setPreconditionCheck(boolean checkPreconditions)
Description copied from interface: ExecutionValidator
Enable/disable precondition validation. Note that if there are existential variables bound by the precondition then the overall execution may fail when precondition evaluation is disabled, in particular if the are required for result evaluation.

Specified by:
setPreconditionCheck in interface ExecutionValidator

setResultCheck

public void setResultCheck(boolean checkResults)
Description copied from interface: ExecutionValidator
Enable/disable result (effects) validation.

Specified by:
setResultCheck in interface ExecutionValidator
